meanings.definition: Made in exact imitation of something valuable with the intention to deceive or defraud.
meanings.sent1: The shopkeeper discovered the counterfeit money in the register.
meanings.sent2: She bought a counterfeit watch that stopped working after a week.
meanings.sent3: The counterfeit painting fooled everyone at the art show.
meanings.sent4: His counterfeit smile did not fool his friends; they knew he was upset.
meanings.sent5: The counterfeit diamond sparkled, but it was just glass.

meanings.definition: To make a fraudulent imitation of something valuable.
meanings.sent1: He counterfeits designer handbags and sells them online.
meanings.sent2: The criminal was arrested for counterfeiting money.
meanings.sent3: She tried to counterfeit her friend's signature as a joke.
meanings.sent4: The artist counterfeited famous paintings and sold them as originals.
meanings.sent5: Counterfeiting products is illegal and unethical.

meanings.definition: A fraudulent imitation of something valuable.
meanings.sent1: The market was flooded with counterfeit goods.
meanings.sent2: She unknowingly purchased a counterfeit necklace.
meanings.sent3: The counterfeit ticket got him into the concert for free.
meanings.sent4: The counterfeit designer bags were being sold on the street.
meanings.sent5: The museum had to verify the authenticity of the painting to ensure it was not a counterfeit.
